content:
CARIN BB and other IGs are continuing to evolve. For example, http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-pdex/StructureDefinition/hrex-coverage
was recently added, and it's unclear how this will co-exist with the CARIN Coverage http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/carin-bb/StructureDefinition-C4BB-Coverage.html.

With issues like this in mind, what is the recommended version to meet the CMS Interoperability rules and meet market expectations for 2021? It's obviously best to offer full support, but if means the target is constantly moving then implementation becomes difficult or impossible.

We are freezing our development (= Anthem) at the end of this month - the changes are already causing us quite a lot of trouble having an end point that is already live. The rules suggest but not mandate the CARIN BB implementation guide, so whatever we managed to implement would have to do

@Art Huston Our IG hasn't had any major changes since September although we fully recognize we haven't published it yet. We are mainly doing clean-up right now but we do recognize folks need to make a call to 'cut off' any additional changes to hit a 1/1 date. Latest build with the associated updates is always located here: https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/carin-bb/index.html. @Saul Kravitz @Pat Taylor @Amol Vyas @Mark Roberts

Current status of the open issues (not many) are in the .ppt below. Approved HL7 FM workgroup timeline for publication is below:
10/13
• Discussion regarding including the “Personas document” as part of the CARIN IG for Blue Button® or in a supplemental guide
• Submit all remaining Jira tickets to FM WG and PIE WG that will not be deferred
10/20
• Financial Management workgroup votes on remaining Jira tickets
• Possible vote to include the “Personas document” in the CARIN IG for Blue Button or as part of a supplemental guide
10/27
• Detailed walkthrough of the CARIN IG for Blue Button® with the FM workgroup
11/3
• Vote to publish the CARIN IG for Blue Button® as an STU1 version

CARIN-Consumer-Directed-Payer-Data-Exchange-IG-Ballot-Reconciliation-2020-1015.pptx
